February 4, 1958
Hr. John M, Parsey
Research Director
National Project In Agricultural
Communications
Michigan State University
East Lansing, Michigan
Dear Johns
Sorry to be so long in responding to your letter after
the Columbus seminar but 1 was looking for a graduate student
or two here whom I thought were capable of carrying on such
a project with a minimum of supervision from me. (Sorry to
tell you that there are darned few of such animals around.)
Anyway, I gave tip the search when X received the news that
Ken Harwood will be doing It. Think this is fine. Ken will
certainly do a top job. X have a lot of respect for his
ability and integrity. X am anxious to see his plan of
attack.
Harry wrote me about the cooperation between HPAC, NAEB,
and ETRC. X am quite pleased with this also. Should certainly
give the final document good distribution and, at the same
time, make funds available for a quite thorough job.
X have no great suggestions for this project. Tour out*
line sounds good. X would, however, like to suggest two
things. The first is quite simple, the second quite dlffl*
cult. (1) X would like to see some emphasis on methodologies
which have been employed ea well as on the findings which have
resulted. This is often helpful to future researchers in tele*
vision end other media, aa well es in radio. (2) X would ilka
to see an evaluation of the studies covered, rather than simply
a description. As you know, there has been some abominable work
carried out in the name of broadcast research (X have even done
some of it myself!) and X believe the compiler of such an lnven*
tory has a responsibility to tha reader to be extremely critical
and honest. This is important for researchers who are to use
this inventory as a reference. This is probably more important
for the practitioner. The researcher, if some of the studies
